intro: Oryctanthus, commonly known as the "cave plant," is a genus of flowering plants native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the "ice plant" family. These plants are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy, often brightly colored flowers. Oryctanthus species are typically found in rocky, well-drained soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are popular among succulent enthusiasts due to their unique appearance and resilience to drought.
